4 import numpy as np

7 class ColorThreshold(Enum):
8  """
9  Class to represent the color thresholds used in the image processing. Colors are defined in HSV space.
10  """
11  RED = [((0, 85, 120), (35, 255, 255)), ((150, 100, 80), (180, 255, 255))]
12  GREEN = [((60, 30, 60), (95, 255, 255))]
13  BLUE = [((100, 50, 100), (125, 255, 255))]
14  ANY = [*RED, *GREEN, *BLUE]
15 
16 
17 class ObjectColor(Enum):
18  """
19  Class to represent the color of the object. Their values are indexed according to the BGR channels.
20  """
21  ANY = -1
22  BLUE = 0
23  GREEN = 1
24  RED = 2
25 
26 
27 Color2Threshold = {
28  ObjectColor.RED: ColorThreshold.RED,
29  ObjectColor.GREEN: ColorThreshold.GREEN,
30  ObjectColor.BLUE: ColorThreshold.BLUE,
31  ObjectColor.ANY: ColorThreshold.ANY
32 }

34 
35 class ObjectShape(Enum):
36  ANY = 0
37  SQUARE = 4
38  CIRCLE = np.inf
39 
40  @classmethod
41  def from_nb_sides(cls, nb_sides: int):
42  if nb_sides < cls.SQUARE.value:
43  raise ValueError(f"Invalid number of sides: {nb_sides}")
44  elif nb_sides == cls.SQUARE.value:
45  return cls.SQUARE
46  else:
47  return cls.CIRCLE
48 
49 
50 @dataclass
51 class Object:
52  """
53  Class to represent an object detected in the scene.
54  """
55 
56  shape: ObjectShape
57  color: ObjectColor
58  x: float
59  y: float
60  yaw: float
